item.title: Report X-2024120384
item.description:
Report X-2024120384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO AIR PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD FROST FORMING ON THE BOTTOM SIDES OF THE BOXES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATLEY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING DOG FOOD. EACH BOX ALSO HAS TWO PACKS OF NON-REGULATED NORDIC ICE PACKS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1ZHJ22880224368262. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES.

item.title: Report E-2024120051
item.description:
Report E-2024120051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0456 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UAD. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of White Pigmented Shellac Primer was released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to a forklift puncture by UAD. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 93. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Greg. Report #2024110700029. Product was containerized to (1) 55-gallon DF contains a 5-gallon plastic pail of White Pigmented Shellac Primer and oil Dri.

item.title: Report E-2024120003
item.description:
Report E-2024120003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 26, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN3149 were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the site. TWE utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
